thread.section_title: Sports - The Daily Republican - Marion, IL
thread.title: Marion soccer blasts Orphans

author: Justin Walker
title: Marion soccer blasts Orphans
text: Marion's boys soccer team defeated the wind and Centralia, 8-0, Saturday morning at Wildcat Stadium Comment   By Justin Walker Posted Oct. 5, 2015 at 12:05 AM By Justin Walker Posted Oct. 5, 2015 at 12:05 AM MARION â€” Marion's boys soccer team defeated the wind and Centralia, 8-0, Saturday morning at Wildcat Stadium. The Wildcats are now 14-4-1 overall and 5-0 in the South Seven Conference. Adam Newman had two of the goals, while Conner Riem, Jared Baysinger, Josh Szidik and Kameron Dover also scored for the Wildcats. Marion plays at home Tuesday night against rival Carbondale with lots of activities planned. It will be Senior Night with varsity at around 6:30 p.m. following JV at 5 p.m. It will also be Marion Rec Soccer Night. All rec league players who wear their team jersey will get free admission and be able to come on the turf after the varsity match to shoot on goal and pass with the high school players. By Justin Walker   By Justin Walker
